page.title: 16Law and Order- Weoley Castle
page.content: Sgt. Reynolds from Bournville Lane Police Station talked to us about police work on beat 26 in B2 Division. Every hour the police get about 80 calls for help. In March 1985 the most common crime was house breaking. Crime is increasing in this area; more cars have been stolen or broken into this year & more people have been attacked. Instead of using a blackboard to record crime figures, police now use computers. As well as solving crimes the police help the public in many ways. They give advice about protecting property against thieves. Our local police come into school to teach us road safety & to warn us about dangerous places to play in this area. Sometimes they bring their dogs & vehicles to show us and equipment such as handcuffs, truncheons and radios. Our police are friendly.
